Course Name: Gender, Society, and Health: Global Perspectives 
Course Description:
 
What are the global patterns and perspectives on gender and health? How do societal contexts and factors shape gender and health around the world? And what are people's aspirations for their health and wellbeing? This lecture-discussion based course will address these questions through a presentation of interdisciplinary theories, research, and case studies across diverse settings, with a particular focus on low and middle-income countries. 
We begin with an overview of global patterns of gender and health in terms of mortality, morbidity, and mental health. We move on to understanding the societal factors that shape these patterns. We then hear testimonies and case studies about people's aspirations and activism for gender and health. We end with learning about ways in which governments, research, activism, and society can collectively work towards improving health. 
By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Explain global patterns of gender and health
Assess societal factors that affect gender and health in diverse global settings
Evaluate empirical evidence, apply theoretical knowledge, and learn research skills to topics related to gender and health.
